verses.roman:
āpanāra kathā likhi nirlajja ha-iyā
nityānanda-guṇe lekhāya unmatta kariyā

synonyms: āpanāra—personal; kathā—description; likhi—I write; nirlajja ha-iyā—being shameless; nityānanda-guṇe—the attributes of Nityānanda; lekhāya—cause to write; unmatta kariyā—making like a madman.
translation: I have described my own story without reservations. The attributes of Lord Nityānanda, making me like a madman, force me to write these things.
